TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit XPathItem extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an item in the XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 Data Model.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An item is either a node or an atomic value.

block.para:
When you inherit from the class, you must override the following members: :

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called by derived class constructors to initialize state in this type.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsNode As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsNode { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the item represents an XPath node or an atomic value.
Docs.value: if the item represents an XPath node; if the item represents an atomic value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property TypedValue As Object
public: abstract property System::Object ^ TypedValue { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the current item as a boxed object of the most appropriate [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] type according to its schema type.
Docs.value: The current item as a boxed object of the most appropriate [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the value of the item is not valid according to its specified schema type, the value of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.TypedValue%2A> property is equivalent to the value of the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.Value%2A> property.
For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=nameWithType> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).

Docs.related: Type Support in the System.Xml Classes

public: abstract property System::String ^ Value { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the value of the item.
Returns the item's value as the specified type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAs%2A> method attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] type specified.

Docs.exception: The item's value is not in the correct format for the target type.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract object ValueAs (Type returnType, System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver nsResolver);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object ValueAs(class System.Type returnType, class System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver nsResolver) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function ValueAs (returnType As Type, nsResolver As IXmlNamespaceResolver) As Object
public: abstract System::Object ^ ValueAs(Type ^ returnType, System::Xml::IXmlNamespaceResolver ^ nsResolver);
abstract member ValueAs : Type * System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver -> obj

Docs.param: The type to return the item's value as.
The object used to resolve namespace prefixes.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the item's value as the type specified using the object specified to resolve namespace prefixes.
Docs.returns: The value of the item as the type requested.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAs%2A> method attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] type specified.
The <xref:System.Xml.IXmlNamespaceResolver> object is used to resolve namespace prefixes related to type conversions. For example, when converting an `xs:QName` to an `xs:string`.
For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=nameWithType> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).

Docs.exception: The item's value is not in the correct format for the target type.
The attempted cast is not valid.
The attempted cast resulted in an overflow.
Docs.related: Type Support in the System.Xml Classes

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ValueAsBoolean As Boolean
public: abstract property bool ValueAsBoolean { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the item's value as a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueAsDateTime%2A> property attempts to convert the value of the item to the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] <xref:System.Boolean> type according to the XPath 2.0 rules for casting the item's type.
For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=nameWithType> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).

Docs.exception: The item's value is not in the correct format for the type.
The attempted cast to is not valid.
Docs.related: Type Support in the System.Xml Classes

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ValueType As Type
public: abstract property Type ^ ValueType { Type ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnext](~/includes/dnprdnext-md.md)] type of the item.
Docs.value: The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] type of the item. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueType%2A> property gets the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] type of the typed value of the item.
For example, an element of type `xs:int` would have a <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueType%2A> of <xref:System.Int32> by default. However, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.ValueType%2A> could be any one of the valid types that can be mapped to `xs:int`, such as <xref:System.Int16> or <xref:System.Double>.
For more information about type support in the <xref:System.Xml?displayProperty=nameWithType> namespace, see [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md).

block.para: All implementers must provide a property for every item, even if it is only .

Docs.related: Type Support in the System.Xml Classes

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property XmlType As XmlSchemaType
public: abstract property System::Xml::Schema::XmlSchemaType ^ XmlType { System::Xml::Schema::XmlSchemaType ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the for the item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem.XmlType%2A> property gets the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaType> for the item. For example, the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaSimpleType> or <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaComplexType>.
